messageBody:
The biggest challenge about testing thread safety must be to simulate that one thread is preempted a a certain vulnerable point, while another thread is accessing shared resources. I was thinking about having the first thread sleep for some time at certain vulnerable points in the code, giving other threads time to access the shared resources, and see what happened. Unfortunately a thread can also be preempted in the middle of a Java instruction like someCounter++, and there's no way to make a Java Thread sleep just after the someCounter has been read from memory, but before it has incremented it and written it back into memory. And that is exactly what we have experienced will happen on a multiprocessor machine, that a thread is preempted in the middle of a Java instruction!!
 
Jakob Jenkov
